com.SIMRacingApps

Class Session

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.SIMRacingApps.Session
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    iRacingSession

    public class Session
extends java.lang.Object
    The class defines access to session level data. There can be different types of sessions, like Practice, Qualifying, Race. The session types are defined by Session.Type.

    Each session contains a reference to the Track. The track's instance can be obtained by calling getTrack().

    Each session contains references to all the cars, both in the session and not. An instance to a can be obtained by calling getCar(String), where the String defines which car to return. If omitted, it returns the Reference Car.

    The session also controls what the reference car is. The default reference car is "ME", but clients can change it. The Reference Car impacts how some lookups for the car are calculated, such as the relative lookups, which means relative to the Reference Car. NOTE: When it's changed, all connected clients will assume the new reference car.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jeffrey Gilliam
    Copyright:
    Copyright (C) 2015 - 2022 Jeffrey Gilliam
    License:
    Apache License 2.0

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Session.CarIdentifiers
      This class enumerates the various car identifiers.
      static class  Session.Message
      This class enumerates the various messages that a SIM can raise that applies to all cars.
      static class  Session.Status
      This class enumerates the values return by getStatus() UNKNOWN ENGINES_STARTED GREEN CAUTION RED FINISHED
      static class  Session.Type
      This class enumerates the values returned by getType() UNKNOWN OPEN_QUALIFY LONE_QUALIFY OFFLINE OFFLINE_TESTING PRACTICE RACE

    • Method Detail

      • getSendKeys

        public java.lang.String getSendKeys(java.lang.String group,
                                    java.lang.String command)
        Returns the string of keys strokes to send to the SIM to issue the command from the group. Each SIM has to override this method and implement it.
        Parameters:
        group - The group to get the commands from (i.e. ADMIN_COMMANDS, RADIO_COMMANDS)
        command - The command within the group to retrieve (i.e. BLACK, ADD)
        Returns:
        The keys to send to the SIM using the syntax defined by SendKeys

      • getCamera

        public Data getCamera()
        Returns the name of the current camera.

        PATH = /Session/Camera

        Returns:
        The name of the current camera in a Data container.

      • getCameras

        public Data getCameras()
        Returns an array of the camera names for this session. The camera names are SIM specific and it is not recommended that you assume what the names will be.

        PATH = /Session/Cameras

        Returns:
        The camera names array in a Data container.
        Since:
        1.3

      • getCar

        public Car getCar(java.lang.String carIndentifier)
        Returns an instance of a Car object as defined by the "car" argument. SIM implementors should override this method and return a SIM specific car object.
        Parameters:
        carIndentifier - A string representing the car you want. Values accepted are:
        ME
        My Car/Driver information
        REFERENCE, R0, RL0, RP0 RPC0
        Defaults to ME, but can be set by the user to any car
        PACE, PACECAR, SAFETY, SAFETYCAR, P0, PC0
        The pace car
        TRANSMITTING
        The car that is currently talking in SIM or TeamSpeak
        LEADER, P1
        The leader
        LEADERCLASS, PC1
        The leader of your class
        LEADERxxx
        The leader if the same class as xxx
        BEST
        The car with the best lap for the entire session
        FASTEST
        The car with the fastest last lap
        Ixx
        The Car Id xx. Used internally to retrieve cars by Id.
        xxx, Nxxx
        The car with this car number
        Pxx
        The Car/Driver at position xx. Note: Position 0 should be the pace car in sessions that have a pace car
        PCxx
        The Car/Driver at position xx in your class. Note: Position 0 should be the pace car in sessions that have a pace car
        R-/+xx
        The Car/Driver relative to REFERENCE by location in the session. Example: R-1 driver behind, R+1 driver ahead
        RC-/+xx
        The Car/Driver relative to REFERENCE by location in the session for the same class as the reference car. Example: RC-1 driver behind in class, RC+1 driver ahead in class
        RL-/+xx
        The Car/Driver relative to REFERENCE by location segregated by On Pit Road and On Track. Example: RL-1 driver behind, RL+1 driver ahead
        RLC-/+xx
        The Car/Driver relative to REFERENCE by location in the same class as the reference car segregated by On Pit Road and On Track. Example: RLC-1 driver behind in class, RLC+1 driver ahead in class
        RP-/+xx
        The Car/Driver relative to REFERENCE by position. Example: RP-1 driver behind, RP+1 driver ahead
        RPCxx
        The Car/Driver at position xx by relative position by class. Example: RPC-1 driver behind, RPC+1 driver ahead in same class
        Returns:
        An instance of Car

      • getCars

        public Data getCars()
        Returns the actual number of cars registered for this session. It does not count the pace car or ghost cars.

        PATH = /Session/Cars

        Returns:
        The number of cars in a Data container.

      • getDataVersion

        public Data getDataVersion()
        Returns a SIM specific string indicating the version of the data just returned. Do not make any assumptions of how this is formatted. Assume it's just a printable string.

        PATH = /Session/DataVersion

        Returns:
        The version in a Data container.

      • getDiffCars

        public Data getDiffCars(java.lang.String carIdentifier1,
                        java.lang.String carIdentifier2)
        Returns the difference between 2 cars as either laps or seconds (if on the same lap). If the 2 cars are the same car, then returns the last lap time or the total session time if the checkered flag is out.

        This sign of the result will be car2 is behind car1, where car2 is the REFERENCE car and car1 is the LEADER, it will return seconds/laps behind as a negative number.

        PATH = /Session/DiffCars/(CARIDENTIFIER1)/(CARIDENTIFIER2)

        Parameters:
        carIdentifier1 - Car as defined by getCar(String), default LEADERxxx.
        carIdentifier2 - Car as defined by getCar(String), default REFERENCE.
        Returns:
        The difference in seconds or laps in a Data container.

      • getDiffCars

        public Data getDiffCars(java.lang.String carIdentifier)

      • getDiffCars

        public Data getDiffCars()

      • getDiffCarsRelative

        public Data getDiffCarsRelative(java.lang.String carIdentifier1,
                                java.lang.String carIdentifier2)
        Calculates the difference between the 2 cars based on their physical distance from each other. This differs from getDiffCars() by the fact it uses the way that car1 and car2 are named to determine position.

        PATH = /Session/DiffCarsRelative/(CARIDENTIFIER1)/(CARIDENTIFIER2)

        Parameters:
        carIdentifier1 - Car as defined by getCar(String)
        carIdentifier2 - Car as defined by getCar(String)
        Returns:
        The difference in seconds in a Data container.

      • getIncidentLimit

        public Data getIncidentLimit()
        Returns the total number of incidents allowed for this session. If the session does not specify them, such as, practice, then 9999 is returned. Different SIMs may measure these in different units of measure. The default is "x".

        PATH = /Session/IncidentLimit

        Returns:
        The incident limit in a Data container.

      • getIsReplay

        public Data getIsReplay()
        Returns true if the session is in replay mode. Otherwise, false which assumes all data is live (real-time).

        PATH = /Session/IsReplay

        Returns:
        true if the green flag is out in a Data container.

      • getLap

        public Data getLap()
        Returns the current lap of the race or REFERENCE car if in a different type of session.

        Current lap is defined as the lap you are about to complete. Meaning that, if you're on lap 1, you just took the green flag.

        PATH = /Session/Lap

        Returns:
        The current lap in a Data container.

      • getLaps

        public Data getLaps(java.lang.String sessionType)
        Returns the total number of laps in the specified session. If the session does not specify them, such as, practice, then 9999 is returned or estimated based on time remaining. Sometimes, sessions are timed and it is not defined. In this case, the laps will be estimated based on the leaders average lap time. If the specified session does not exist, then the State will be set to OFF and zero returned.

        PATH = /Session/Laps/(SESSIONTYPE)

        Parameters:
        sessionType - The session type, Session.Type, to get the laps from. Defaults to current session.
        Returns:
        The number of laps in a Data container.

      • getLaps

        public Data getLaps()

      • getLapsToGo

        public Data getLapsToGo()
        Returns the number of laps to go in sessions that define a total number of laps See getLaps()

        PATH = /Session/LapsToGo

        Returns:
        The number of laps to go in a Data container.

        public Data getLeagueId()

        PATH = /Session/LeagueId 1.2

        Returns:
        The League Id in a Data container.
        Since:
        1.2

      • getMessages

        public Data getMessages()
        Returns a string of a semicolon separate list of messages that are currently active. It is possible to have multiple messages. Each message will have a semicolon before and after it, even at the begin and end of the string. Possible message values are determined by Session.Message. You can display as is, or use it as an index to the the translation for a particular language.

        For example: ";ONELAPTOGREEN;"

        PATH = /Session/Messages

        Returns:
        A list of messages in a Data container.

      • getName

        public Data getName(java.lang.String session)
        Returns the name of the session. This name is SIM dependent and should not be used for decision making, only display.

        PATH = /Session/Name/(session)

        Parameters:
        session - (optional) The session identifier. Defaults to current session.
        Returns:
        A list of messages in a Data container.

      • setRadioChannel

        public Data setRadioChannel(int channel)
        Makes the specified radio channel the active channel to transmit on. If you cannot transmit on this channel, it does not change the active channel.

        PATH = /Session/setRadioChannel/(CHANNELNUMBER)

        Parameters:
        channel - The channel number.
        Returns:
        the active channel number in a Data container.

        Parameters:
        channel - (Optional) The channel number. Defaults to the active channel.
        flag - (Optional) Y to mute, N to unmute. Default is Y.
        Returns:
        the channel number muted in a Data container.

      • setRadioChannelMute

        public Data setRadioChannelMute(java.lang.String channel,
                                java.lang.String flag)

      • setRadioChannelMute

        public Data setRadioChannelMute(java.lang.String channel)

      • setRadioChannelMute

        public Data setRadioChannelMute()

      • setRadioChannelName

        public Data setRadioChannelName(java.lang.String channelName)
        Makes the specified radio channel the active channel to transmit on. If the channel does not exist, an attempt to create the channel is done. If the channel already exists, and you can transmit on it, it will join that channel and make it the active channel.

        PATH = /Session/setRadioChannelName/(CHANNELNAME)

        Parameters:
        channelName - The channel name, limited to 15 characters.
        Returns:
        the channel name in a Data container.

      • setRadioScan

        public Data setRadioScan(boolean flag)
        Turns the scanning of the channels on and off, such that, you are only listening on the active channel. Some channels may not turn off based on the SIM, such as, RACECONTROL or ADMIN channels.

        PATH = /Session/setRadioScan/(Y/N)

        Parameters:
        flag - Y to enable scanning, N to disable scanning
        Returns:
        flag in a Data container.

      • setRadioScan

        public Data setRadioScan(java.lang.String flag)

      • getReplay

        public Data getReplay()
        Returns the state of the current replay position.
        >
        Playing at Normal Speed
        << {speed}x
        Rewinding
        >> {speed}x
        Fast Forwarding
        ||
        Paused

        PATH = /Session/Replay

        Returns:
        A string representing the replay state in a Data container.
        Since:
        1.3

      • setReplay

        public Data setReplay(java.lang.String command)
        Tells the replay system what to do. Note, some SIMs require you to get out of the car first.
        PLAY, >
        Start Playing at Normal Speed
        REWIND, RW, <, <<
        Start Rewinding. Multiple presses will go faster.
        FASTFORWARD, FF, >>
        Start Fast Forwarding. Multiple presses will go faster.
        PAUSE, ||
        Pause the replay
        SLOWMOTION, SM, |>
        Slow down the replay play back speed in the current direction. Multiple presses will go slower.

        PATH = /Session/setReplay/(COMMAND)

        Parameters:
        command - The command to execute. Defaults to PLAY.
        Returns:
        The speed the replay is currently playing at in a Data container.
        Since:
        1.3

      • setReplayPosition

        public Data setReplayPosition(java.lang.String command)
        Tells the replay system what position to start playing at. Here are the available commands.
        BEGINNING, START
        Start Playing at the beginning
        ENDING, END
        Go to end of replay. If in a session, should take you back to live.
        NEXTFRAME, NEXT
        Go to the next frame
        PREVFRAME, PREV
        Go to the previous frame
        NEXTLAP
        Go to the next lap
        PREVLAP
        Go to the previous lap
        NEXTCRASH
        Go to the next crash
        PREVCRASH
        Go to the previous crash
        NEXTSESSION
        Go to the next session, Practice, Qualifying, Race
        PREVSESSION
        Go to the previous session, Practice, Qualifying, Race
        FORWARD15
        Go forward 15 seconds
        BACKWARD15
        Go backwards 15 seconds
        FORWARD30
        Go forward 30 seconds
        BACKWARD30
        Go backwards 30 seconds
        FORWARD60
        Go forward 60 seconds
        BACKWARD80
        Go backwards 60 seconds

        PATH = /Session/setReplayPosition/(COMMAND)

        Parameters:
        command - The position to go to.
        Returns:
        The speed the replay is currently playing at in a Data container.
        Since:
        1.3

      • getSpotterPitCountDown

        public Data getSpotterPitCountDown()
        Returns if the SIM has own pit count down spotter enabled.

        PATH = /Session/SpotterPitCountDown

        Returns:
        Y if SIM is counting down, N if not in a Data container.

      • getStartTime

        public Data getStartTime()
        Returns the time the current session started as the number of seconds since Jan 1, 1970 UTC. It may be adjusted by the SIM to reflect a virtual date/time being simulated. But, that will be in UTC as well. The offset of the time zone is in the State in the format of +/-HHMM. You can use the com.SIMRacingApps.Track.getTimeZone() to display the track's time zone, but to convert to the time zone of the track use the offset returned in the Data.State field. This will account for daylight savings time.

        PATH = /Session/StartTime

        Returns:
        The start time in a Data container.

      • getStatus

        public Data getStatus()
        Returns the status of the session as one of the following defined in Session.Status.
        • UNKNOWN
        • ENGINES_STARTED
        • GREEN
        • CAUTION
        • RED
        • FINISHED

        PATH = /Session/Status 1.12

        Returns:
        The status in a Data container.
        Since:
        1.12

      • getStrengthOfField

        public Data getStrengthOfField()
        Returns a String that is SIM specific that represents the strength of the field. This implies a SIM has some sort of ranking system. Do not assume a specific format of this string. It is for display purposes only.

        PATH = /Session/StrengthOfField

        Returns:
        The strength of the field in a Data container.

      • getTime

        public Data getTime()
        Returns the time of the current session as the number of seconds since Jan 1, 1970 UTC. It may be adjusted by the SIM to reflect a virtual date/time being simulated. But, that will be in UTC as well. The offset of the time zone is in the State in the format of +/-HHMM. You can use the com.SIMRacingApps.Track.getTimeZone() to display the track's time zone, but to convert to the time zone of the track use the offset returned in the Data.State field. This will account for daylight savings time.

        PATH = /Session/Time

        Returns:
        The start time in a Data container.

      • getTimeString

        public Data getTimeString()
        Returns the time of the current session in the time zone of the track using the following format. YYYYMMDDHHMMSS It may be adjusted by the SIM to reflect a virtual date/time being simulated. You can use the com.SIMRacingApps.Track.getTimeZone() to display the track's time zone.

        PATH = /Session/TimeString

        Returns:
        The start time in a Data container.

      • getTimeElapsed

        public Data getTimeElapsed()
        Returns the number of seconds since the current session started.

        PATH = /Session/TimeElapsed

        Returns:
        The number of seconds in current session in a Data container.

      • getTimeRemaining

        public Data getTimeRemaining()
        If the current session has a time restriction, this returns the number of seconds remaining. If the session is laps bound and the laps to go is not estimated, then the time remaining will be estimated. If there is no time restriction, then the time is estimated based on the leader's average lap times. The UOM will be prefixed with a tilde(~) to indicate it is an approximate time.

        PATH = /Session/TimeRemaining

        Returns:
        The number of seconds remaining in a Data container.

      • getTrack

        public Track getTrack()
        Returns an instance to the Track in this session Each SIM will have to provide an override that does not return a null
        Returns:
        An instance of Track

      • getType

        public Data getType()
        Returns the type of the current session as defined by Session.Type

        PATH = /Session/Type

        Returns:
        The session type in a Data container.

      • getReferenceCar

        public Data getReferenceCar()
        Returns the reference car identifier as defined by getCar(String). The default reference car is "ME", but can be changed by calling setReferenceCar(String)

        PATH = /Session/ReferenceCar

        Returns:
        The reference car identifier in a Data container.

      • setAdvanceFlag

        public Data setAdvanceFlag()
        Advance to next Session. This will tell the SIM go to the next session, practice to qualify to grid to end of race. This command is SIM specific and requires special privileges to succeed.

        PATH = /Session/setAdvanceFlag

        Returns:
        The string sent to SIM in a Data container.

      • setCamera

        public Data setCamera(java.lang.String cameraName,
                      java.lang.String focusOn,
                      java.lang.String carIdentifier)
        Changes the camera. This is very SIM specific. Some SIMs can do this, others cannot. The name of the camera is very SIM specific. Some SIMs limit the camera you can choose based on if you are driving or spectating or watching a replay. So, if the SIM doesn't allow the change, then this function will not really know. Therefore, there I cannot detect an error condition.

        PATH = /Session/setCamera/(CAMERA)/(FOCUSON)/(CARIDENTIFIER)

        Parameters:
        cameraName - The name of the camera. Can be the string CURRENT or blank to use the currently selected camera.
        focusOn - (Optional) What to focus on. Valid values are (CRASHES,LEADER,EXCITING,DRIVER). Default is DRIVER.
        carIdentifier - (Optional) A car identifier as defined by getCar(String). Default is REFERENCE.
        Returns:
        The camera name in a Data container.
        Since:
        1.3

      • setCamera

        public Data setCamera(java.lang.String cameraName,
                      java.lang.String focusOn)

      • setCamera

        public Data setCamera(java.lang.String cameraName)

      • setCameraFocus

        public Data setCameraFocus(java.lang.String focusOn,
                           java.lang.String carIdentifier)
        Changes the focus of the current camera. This is very SIM specific. Some SIMs can do this, others cannot. The name of the camera is very SIM specific. Some SIMs limit the camera you can choose based on if you are driving or spectating or watching a replay. So, if the SIM doesn't allow the change, then this function will not really know. Therefore, there I cannot detect an error condition.

        PATH = /Session/setCamera/(FOCUSON)/(CARIDENTIFIER)

        Parameters:
        focusOn - What to focus on. Valid values are (CRASHES,LEADER,EXCITING,DRIVER). Default is DRIVER.
        carIdentifier - (Optional) A car identifier as defined by getCar(String). Default is REFERENCE.
        Returns:
        The camera name in a Data container.

      • setCameraFocus

        public Data setCameraFocus(java.lang.String focusOn)

      • setChat

        public Data setChat(java.lang.String text)
        Sends the text string as a chat message to all drivers. Each SIM must override this method and provide this functionality.

        PATH = /Session/setChat/(TEXT)

        Parameters:
        text - The text to send to the chat window
        Returns:
        The text string sent to the drivers in a Data container.

      • setChatReply

        public Data setChatReply(java.lang.String text)
        Sends the text string as a chat message to the last driver to send you a private message. Each SIM must override this method and provide this functionality.

        PATH = /Session/setChatReply/(TEXT)

        Parameters:
        text - The text to send to the chat window
        Returns:
        The text string sent to the drivers in a Data container.

        PATH = /Session/setChatFlag/(Y/N)

        Parameters:
        onOffFlag - Y/N to turn chat on or off for all drivers.
        Returns:
        The string sent to SIM in a Data container.

        PATH = /Session/setCautionLapsAdjust/(LAPS)

        Parameters:
        laps - +/- the number of laps to add to the current caution laps.
        Returns:
        The string sent to SIM in a Data container.
